title: Correcting Misrepresentations of the Reformation and Classical Protestantism
description:
This video is a response to a video from @GospelSimplicity on Protestant departures from Thomistic approaches to the world. In this talk, I discuss how common portrayals of Protestant intellectual history completely misrepresent the theology and philosophy of the Age of Orthodoxy following the Reformation. These narratives are popularly shared on social media by Roman Catholic apologists, and are also present in more scholarly material, such as in the work of Brad Gregory.

You can find Austin's original video here: https://youtu.be/wZDB_jMqn4s?si=RLdtQBpnwtqkAW4U

Dr. Jordan B. Cooper (Director of Just & Sinner/ Chair of Lutheran Dogmatics ALTS/ Minister in Residence With Lutheran Student Fellowship at Cornell/ Author of 11 Books/ Speaker/ Podcast Host)

title: Is Justification by Faith Alone a Legal Fiction? Defending the Reformation View of Salvation
description:
Gavin Ortlund, Dr. Jordan Cooper, and Dr. Michael Horton discuss the Reformation doctrine of justification through faith alone, the question of medieval nominalism, nature and grace, the donum superadditum, the accusation that justification is a "legal fiction," and various other topics.

This is part 3 of a 6 part series.

DEFENDING THE REFORMATION is a 6 part series bringing together Gavin Ortlund, Jordan Cooper, and Michael Horton to address some of the most prominent criticisms of the Reformation and key Protestant doctrines. Were the Reformers true reformers or radical revolutionaries? Does Sola Scriptura undermine church tradition? Is Sola Fide merely a product of nominalism? Together, these Protestant theologians examine the historical context, theological depth, and biblical fidelity of the Reformation. Subscribe to each channel to follow the whole series:
‪@solamediaorg‬ 
⁨‪@TruthUnites‬ 
‪@DrJordanBCooper‬ 

The other videos in this series:
Part 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0Wm6Hq7G2c&t=1412s
Part 2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tqr4vcOhF-Q&t=414s

A brief introduction to nominalism: https://youtu.be/Ixgl6VdRUNA?si=T3YKrkdFAUCCTRbp

title: Did the Reformation Depart from Thomas Aquinas's View of God as Being?
description:
This video is part of a longer talk to be released on 12/26/2025 on the topic of the Reformation's relationship to classical Christian views of reality, including that of Thomas Aquinas. This is a response to a brief video from @GospelSimplicity that summarizes popular narratives proposing a strong departure in the Reformation from earlier views of God and nature.

You can find Austin's original video here: https://youtu.be/wZDB_jMqn4s?si=veUjB3skZ5KUl2LS

title: John Duns Scotus: The First Modern Thinker? (Makers of the Modern World)
description:
This video in the Makers of the Modern World series explores the teaching of the late medieval scholastic theologian John Duns Scotus. While he precedes modernity by quite some time, many have argued that Scotus's views mark the first clear departure from the classical Greek/Christian synthesis which the West relied on since the beginning of Christianity toward a new set of problems and questions.

title: Does Scripture Allow the Church to Withhold the Communion Cup from the Laity?
description:
This video is a response to some recent comments from @SinceAD33 on the subject of Communion in one kind. I discuss the Scriptural testimony regarding the need to offer and receive the blood of Christ by means of consecrated wine. This is inspired by a broader discussion on Roman Catholicism initiated by @redeemed_zoomer 

Issues etc.: https://issuesetc.org/guest/jordan-cooper/

You can find his full video here: https://youtu.be/cxpSfDwsbLA?si=MsOUITkDiB7FXlaw

My previous video on the subject: https://youtu.be/TMA4AFV6MAs

title: Leibniz and German Rationalism (Makers of the Modern World)
description:
This video in the Makers of the Modern World series explores the German philosopher Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz and the birth of German rationalism. I discuss his challenge to traditional scholastic thought, and his relation to Lutheran orthodoxy.

The full playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4wTeJG59DeY&list=PLxaDcwyjYomz_-v55pBIQ2-SpG3HvJPlO

title: Where Should We Start? With the One God or the Three Persons? An Ongoing Theological Debate
description:
This is a clip from a longer video on the essence and attributes of God as part of the Intro to Theology series. In this video, I discuss an ongoing debate about whether theology should begin with the oneness of God or with the Trinity.
The full talk: https://youtu.be/xbcLhhK0IdY?si=xWpi1K593SgRYFto
The playlist for the series: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iCXREr8MbwE&list=PLxaDcwyjYomw9BhNdTDvL21ddfMV71Yn4

title: How do Truth, Goodness, and Beauty Relate to God and Meaning in Life? A Christian & Atheist Dialogue
description: This is a discussion between me (Jordan B. Cooper) and Dr. Jani Hakkarainen at Tampere University in Finland which was hosted by Veritas Forum. We discussed the transcendentals and how meaning is found in life. I presented a Christian approach, while Dr. Hakkarainen addressed the subject through the lens of 19th century Bildung philosophy.

title: Dr. Gifford Grobien and Fr. Raymund Snyder on Virtue in the Lutheran and Catholic Traditions
description:
Virtue and Flourishing in the Catholic and Lutheran Traditions: A Moral Ecology Trust Conference

For millennia, the formation of good character was the primary aim of education in the home, school, congregation, and community. Two historic communities—the Roman Catholic and Lutheran traditions—offer rich resources that have fed institutions for centuries with the theory, teaching, and habits to form good people, virtuous citizens, and wise leaders. But this aim has all but disappeared from our institutions and societies. To address this, three leading philosophers and theologians from each of these two traditions will speak about the theory, the teaching, and the practical work that can be recovered in late modernity to form character and virtue for the flourishing of all.

This first session features talks from Dr. Jordan B. Cooper and Fr. Ezra Sullivan.

Jordan Cooper is an ordained Lutheran pastor, the Executive Director of Just & Sinner, Fellow of Systematic Theology at the Weidner Institute, and the Chair of Lutheran Dogmatics at the American Lutheran Theological Seminary.

Ezra Sullivan, OP, is a professor of moral theology and psychology at the University of St. Thomas Aquinas in Rome (Angelicum).

title: Dr. Joel Biermann and Fr. Michael Sherwin on Virtue in Catholic and Lutheran Traditions
description:
Virtue and Flourishing in the Catholic and Lutheran Traditions: A Moral Ecology Trust Conference

For millennia, the formation of good character was the primary aim of education in the home, school, congregation, and community. Two historic communities—the Roman Catholic and Lutheran traditions—offer rich resources that have fed institutions for centuries with the theory, teaching, and habits to form good people, virtuous citizens, and wise leaders. But this aim has all but disappeared from our institutions and societies. To address this, three leading philosophers and theologians from each of these two traditions will speak about the theory, the teaching, and the practical work that can be recovered in late modernity to form character and virtue for the flourishing of all.

This first session features talks from Dr. Jordan B. Cooper and Fr. Ezra Sullivan.

Jordan Cooper is an ordained Lutheran pastor, the Executive Director of Just & Sinner, Fellow of Systematic Theology at the Weidner Institute, and the Chair of Lutheran Dogmatics at the American Lutheran Theological Seminary.

Ezra Sullivan, OP, is a professor of moral theology and psychology at the University of St. Thomas Aquinas in Rome (Angelicum).

title: Does Justification by Faith Happen Apart from All Good Works or Only from Ceremonial Works?
description:
This video is part of a longer talk on the doctrine of justification by faith alone in response to Bishop Robert Barron @BishopBarron . In this section, I discuss Paul's use of the phrase "works of the law," and address the common argument that Paul excludes only *some* works from justification, rather than *all* good works.

For the full video, go here: https://youtu.be/l1TEw1keSo0?si=tXP9BVWyEQbGSaK5

For millennia, the formation of good character was the primary aim of education in the home, school, congregation, and community. Two historic communities—the Roman Catholic and Lutheran traditions—offer rich resources that have fed institutions for centuries with the theory, teaching, and habits to form good people, virtuous citizens, and wise leaders. This video discusses the existence of the natural world according to Descartes, which arises out of his conviction that the self exists, and that God exists.

title: Does Acceptance of the Bible Mean Acceptance of Roman Catholic Authority?
description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This video is a brief answer to the challenge of Roman Catholic apologists who argue that the Roman Catholic Church determined the Biblical canon, and that acceptance of the canon is inherently also an acceptance of the authority of the Roman magisterium.

title: The Eternal Relations Between Father, Son, and Spirit as Giving and Receiving Love (Divine Love 3)
description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This program is a discussion of eternal generation and procession as giving and receiving love between Father, Son, and Spirit. It is the third in a series on Ernst Sartorius's book The Doctrine of Divine Love.

description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org
You can find the full video here: https://youtu.be/aonHbGLv2sc?si=UNzBYvkKUBx3daA5

This video is part of a discussion of Ernst Sartorius's book The Doctrine of Divine Love. This touches on religious epistemology, the transcendentals, and how we understand our world wrongly.

description:

description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This video is a discussion of the doctrine of justification by faith alone and the common criticism leveled by Roman Catholics which claims that the apostle James contradicts Luther's interpretation of Paul.

description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This video is an overview of the Roman Catholic and Lutheran ecumenical dialogues which occurred in the 1960s surrounding the Office of the Holy Ministry and the Eucharist. I plan to do more on these fascinating discussions which remain relevant to our contemporary context.

http://justandsinner.org

description:
Our website: http://www.justandsinner.org

This video is a continuation in the series on Christology in which I respond to Gavin Ortlund's @TruthUnites  recent video critiquing Lutheran Christology. In this second part, I address the Biblical evidence, and show the textual arguments in favor of Lutheran Christology and the communication idiomatum.

title: A Response to Gavin Ortlund on Lutheran Christology
description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This is the first part of a response to @TruthUnites critique of Lutheran Christology. In this video, I give an explanation of what Lutheran Christology is, and how it is often misconstrued in Reformed critiques. I discuss the nature of attributions given to Jesus according to both natures, the differences in belief among Lutherans regarding Christ's state of humiliation, and how "ubiquity" is an unhelpful term to characterize the Lutheran view.

description: There are no inherent rights #rights #conservatism #politicalphilosophy #philosophy #humanrights #christian #christianity #politics #conservativephilosophy #conservative

description:

Patreon: http://patreon.com/justandsinner

title: Thomas Hobbes on the State (Makers of the Modern World)
description:
Our website: http://www.justandsinner.org

This video is part of our ongoing "Makers of the Modern World" series which is soon to be a book. In this video, I discuss the ideas of Thomas Hobbes which led to the birth of the liberal political order. I discuss the nature of rights, the role of the state, and human nature in its "state of nature" prior to the creation of the social contract.

title: Does sola scriptura lead to discarding well-established dogma?
description: Sola Scriptura and dogma #catholic #scripture #theology #doctrine #protestant #romancatholic #solascriptura #papacy #magisterium #authority #christian #christianity #christiantheology

title: Hugo Grotius's View of the State
description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This video is a short clip of a longer talk on Thomas Hobbes's view of the state as expressed in his book Leviathan. This video overviews one of the most influential thinkers both on Hobbes and on Western political thought more generally, Hugo Grotius. It is Grotius who first grounds the state in the conception of rights (or really a singular right).

title: The Division Between Theory and Practice, or Orthodoxy vs. Pietism
description:
This is part of a longer discussion on Ernst Sartorius's Doctrine of Divine Love in which he discusses the distinction between theology and ethics as was reinforced by Kant's philosophy.

title: Dispelling Roman Catholic Falsehoods About the Protestant Work Ethic
description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This video is a discussion of the "Protestant work ethic," and the blame placed on Luther for a culture of consumption. In response to common critiques, I discuss Luther's doctrine of vocation and its positive contributions.

description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This video is a discussion of the nature of social media, how it distorts our perception of others, and habituates us into unhealthy patterns of thought and action.

title: The Relationship Between Theology and Ethics (The Doctrine of Divine Love Part 1)
description:
Our website: http://justandsinner.org

This video is the beginning of a series of talks on the work The Doctrine of Divine Love by Ernst Sartorius. This first video addresses the relationship between theology and ethics, and the proposal offered by Sartorius as to how these two disciplines come together.

This series on Sartorius is part of the larger series on the doctrine of the mystical union. Sartorius shows how the mystical union with God is rooted in love, and that love serves as the basis for the ethical life.

description:
Our website: http://www.justandsinner.org
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

Our website: http://www.justandsinner.org

This video addresses the Christology of the early church fathers, including Ignatius, Irenaeus, Justin Martyr, and Origen. I then look at Antiochene and Alexandrian Christological models and debates surrounding the union of the divine and human natures.

Our website: http://www.justandsinner.org
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video addresses the question of which church I would attend if I were not Lutheran.

title: Is Cultural Marxism Just a Right-Wing Conspiracy Theory?
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video I discuss cultural Marxism and the claims that the right has invented this idea. I demonstrate that this is not the case, as evidence has existed for decades that the term has been used to define a specific movement and understanding of culture within academia.

title: Should Christians Censor what they Watch on Television?
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video discusses the question of entertainment, and what Christians should and should not watch on television or in movies.

title: Who Were the Nephilim?
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video, I discuss the identity of the Nephilim in Genesis 6.

title: On Mysticism in Lutheran Tradition
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video addresses Christian mysticism and its relationship to both Martin Luther and the later Lutheran tradition.

title: A Tour of my Office
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This is a brief tour of my office, because you've asked for it.

title: Sola Fide in the Church Fathers
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
My Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This is a video of my podcast discussing the church fathers and their approach to justification in light of the Lutheran doctrine of sola fide.

title: Thoughts on the Shepherd's Conference Q&A on Social Justice
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This is my response to the recent 2019 Shepherd's Conference Q&A panel in which some hostility is shown between Phil Johnson and Al Mohler over differing views of social justice.

title: Does the Incarnation Negate Divine Immutability?
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video is from a podcast in which I answer a question about God's immutability and the whether that classical understanding of God is negated by the incarnation of the Son of God.

title: A Defense of Sola Scriptura
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This is a defense of the teaching of Sola Scriptura as taught in the Lutheran church as opposed to the perspective of both the Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox traditions.

title: An Explanation of Sola Scriptura
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video is an explanation of the teaching of Sola Scriptura, or Scripture alone, in the Lutheran tradition compared with the views of Roman Catholicism, the Anabaptists, and the Reformed church.

title: I Completed my PhD!
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

I have completed my PhD in Theology, and I wanted to update everyone and gives thanks for all the support you have given me over the years.

title: Philip Melanchthon in the Reformation and the Lutheran Tradition
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video discusses Philip Melanchthon and his relationship to Martin Luther, as well as his role in the Lutheran tradition and the Lutheran Confessions.

title: Intersectionality: An Explanation and Critique
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video is an explanation of intersectionality as developed by Kimberle Crenshaw. I discuss the ideological foundations of this movement, and then give criticisms, explaining the reasons why I find intersectionality to be flawed.

title: Q&A Podcast February 27, 2019
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

Today's podcast is the second Q&A program this month. Since last week's show was limited to two questions, I decided to do a second to address several other important topics. I addressed intersectionality, the loss of mystical language within Lutheranism, Melanchthon's role in the Reformation, and other issues.

title: Socrates (A History of Western Thought 9)
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This is part of my History of Western Thought series in which I explain the life and teachings of Socrates. I discuss Plato's version of the philosopher, and explain the Socratic method of teaching. I discuss his view on ethics, virtue, and knowledge.

title: On Entire Sanctification
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video addresses the Wesleyan idea of entire sanctification and its connection to what I have called Christification. I discuss a Lutheran approach to the topic.

title: Origen: Saint or Heretic?
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

The church father Origen has often been a subject of debate among Church historians and Christian theologians. Some have accused him of being a dangerous heretic, whereas others have tried to revive his thought. In this video, I address those questions and give my own evaluation of the church father Origen.

title: Views on Israel's Conquest of Canaan
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video addresses  various approaches to the Canaanite conquest described in the book of Joshua.

title: The Distinction Between Homologoumena and Antilegomena
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video discusses the distinction between Homologoumena and Antilegomena  which was used both by the church fathers and early Lutheran writers to explain the canon of the New Testament.

title: Differences between LCMS and WELS
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video I discuss the differences between the LCMS (Lutheran Church Missouri Synod) and WELS (Wisconsin Evangelical Lutheran Synod). Specifically, I address the question of church fellowship and prayer fellowship.

title: Essentialism and Gender
description:
my website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video, I discuss philosophical essentialism and modern gender theory. I explain realism and its differentiation from both nominalism and conceptualism.

title: A Non-Calvinistic Interpretation of Romans 9
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This is a video recording of my podcast in which I work through Romans 9 and discuss questions of Calvinism and double-predestination in the text. I present a contextual alternate reading which avoids the problem of the eternal decree of reprobation.

title: A Critique of the Papacy
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video is a podcast in which I discuss the papacy, and give a critique of popular Roman Catholic arguments. I address the question of Peter's successors according to both history and Scripture.

title: On Apostolic Succession
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video, I address the question of apostolic succession, and views related to that in the Roman Catholic, Eastern Orthodox, and Lutheran traditions. I also discuss how the early Christians approached the topic.

title: Five Reasons I Am Not Roman Catholic
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video I give five reasons why I am not Roman Catholic, and instead remain in the Lutheran church.

title: The Role of Reason in Reformed Theology
description:
Further resources:
https://www.jordanbcooper.com/

Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/JustandSinner

This video answers a question I received regarding the role of reason in Reformed theology. I discuss differences between the Lutheran and Reformed traditions and their views of reason and revelation.

title: The Differences Between Lutheranism and Eastern Orthodoxy
description:
For further resources on Eastern Orthodoxy:
http://justandsinner.libsyn.com/category/Eastern+Orthodoxy

My website of theological and philosophical resources:
https://www.jordanbcooper.com/

Consider becoming a supporter through Patreon:
http://patreon.com/justandsinner

There are areas of agreement and disagreement between the Lutheran and Eastern Orthodox traditions. In this video, taken from my last Q&A podcast, I explain what some of those primary differences are.

title: Q&A Podcast January 2019
description:
This is a question and answer Just and Sinner podcast. On it, I answered questions about ecclesiology, Eastern Orthodoxy, apostolic succession and many other topics.

Check out my Patreon: http://Patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: Is Beauty Objective or Subjective?
description: In this video, I answer the question: "Is beauty objective or subjective?" I conclude that there has to be some kind of objectivity in our understanding of beauty and the arts against various forms of aesthetic relativism.

title: Dualism in Descartes and Classical Philosophy
description: Renes Descartes promoted what is known as substance dualism and created the mind-body problem in modern philosophy. This differs from the dualism of earlier thinkers such as Plato, Aristotle, and Thomas Aquinas.

title: A Theologian's Response to Jordan Peterson on God
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

Jordan Peterson is often asked about his views on God and Christianity, and is sometimes portrayed as a Christian thinker. However, he is clearly not a Christian in a historic orthodox sense of the term. This is a discussion of some of his comments on the subject.

title: Aquinas' First Way (Proofs for the Existence of God)
description:
This is an explanation of the classical argument for the existence of God known as the argument from motion. It is the first of Thomas' Aquinas' five ways of proving the existence of God, or the unmoved mover. 

For further information about these arguments, check out the following books:

https://www.amazon.com/Does-God-Exist-Socratic-Dialogue/dp/0999667076/

https://www.amazon.com/Five-Proofs-Existence-Edward-Feser/dp/1621641333/

title: Covenant Theology (Theology Video Encyclopedia)
description: This entry in the Theology Video Encyclopedia is on covenant theology, also known as federal theology. I discuss the covenant of works and the covenant of grace.

title: The Mary Argument Against Physicalism (Philosophy of Mind)
description: This is an explanation of what is known as the Mary Argument or the Mary's Room Argument against a physicalist understanding of mind. This is one of the most important discussions currently occurring in debates between dualists and materialists. This is also sometimes known as the Knowledge Argument.

title: Was Luther Anti-Semitic?
description:
It is often claimed that Martin Luther was an anti-Semite because of some of his later writings on Jews. In this video, I address the connection between Luther, racism, and the nazis.

For further information, check out this video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MTzLCZXAEpg

Also, this book:
https://www.amazon.com/Fabricated-Luther-Refuting-Connections-Modern/dp/0758608551/

title: The Sophists (A History of Western Thought 8)
description: This is part eight of the series A History of the Western Thought. This is the final video covering the Pre-Socratic era, in which I explain the school known as the Sophists.

title: The Problem with Discernment Ministries
description: This is a response to a question I received about my views on discernment ministries. I discuss why I do not find them to be helpful or beneficial.

title: The Difference Between the AALC and the LCMS
description: This is a brief explanation of the differences between the AALC and the LCMS.

title: Why I Don't Get Involved in the Creation Debate
description: People are always asking me questions about the days of creation, the arguments of groups like Answers and Genesis, and related topics. This video is an explanation of why I do not get involved in that debate.

title: Q&A Program October 10, 2018
description: This is a question and answer podcast video on all sorts of topics that you sent in.

title: Liturgical Worship: A Lutheran Introduction
description: I have released a new book called "Liturgical Worship: A Lutheran Introduction." You can check it out on Amazon in both paperback and kindle formats: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07HHF6D87

title: Cultural Marxism Explained
description: This video is an explanation of cultural Marxism, which is a term often thrown around in contemporary political and social debates. Here, those ideas are explored in a brief format.

title: The Atomists (A History of Western Thought 7)
description: On this program, I discuss the philosophy of the Atomists, who promoted an early form of materialist philosophy. This series has, so far, covered the major Pre-Socratic philosophers.

title: Anaxagoras (A History of Western Thought 6)
description: This video discusses the philosophy of Anaxagoras among the pre-socratic philosophers. This is part six in the series, "A History of Western Thought."

title: Consecrationism and Receptionism
description: In this entry of the Theology Video Encyclopedia, we discuss the debate between consecrationism and receptionism within Lutheran thought.

title: The Third Use of the Law
description: This entry in the Theology Video Encyclopedia covers the third use of the law as taught in Reformation traditions, as well as debates on the topic.

title: Classical Theism vs. Theistic Personalism
description: In this entry in the Theology Video Encyclopedia, I discuss the disagreements between the two rival positions: Theistic Personalism, and Classical Theism.

title: The Distinction Between Law and Gospel
description:
This is an entry in the Theology Video Encyclopedia on the distinction between law and gospel. For more in-depth explanations of the subject, check out these two lectures I have given on the topic:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hq_nZfca0Cw&t=721s

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fb9B6DbIMCk

title: Empedocles (A History of Western Thought 5)
description: This is part five of the series, "A History of Western Thought," on the philosopher Empedocles. This thinker was the first to try and reconcile the views of both Heraclitus and the Eleatic philosophers such as Zeno and Parmenides.

title: The Federal Vision
description: This video is part of a series called, "The Theology Video Encyclopedia," which overviews various theological topics in a short explanatory format. This video is on the subject of the Federal Vision movement.

title: The Eleatic Philosophers (A History of Western Thought 4)
description: This is the fourth program in the series "A History of Western Thought," which covers the Eleatic philosophers. This includes: Xenophanes, Zeno, and Parmenides.

title: The Sacraments: Holy Baptism and the Lord's Supper by Jordan Cooper
description: This is the second part of the final Hold the Line lecture on the means of grace. This section covers both Baptism and the Lord's Supper.

title: God's Victory: The Means of Grace by Curtis Leins
description: This is the third talk given at the Hold the Line Conference hosted by the AALC. This begins a discussion of the means of grace.

title: God's Truth: Law and Gospel by Jordan Cooper
description: This is the second lecture delivered at the Hold the Line Conference on the topic of Law and Gospel.

title: God's Word: Holy Scripture by Rev. Dr. Curtis Leins
description: This talk was presented by the Rev. Dr. Curtis E. Leins, the presiding pastor of the AALC, at the Hold the Line Conference. The subject is Holy Scripture.

title: The Two Kinds of Righteousness by Joel Biermann
description: This is the fourth in a series of lectures from Dr. Joel Biermann delivered at the 2018 AALC National Convention. The topic of this talk is the two kinds of righteousness.

title: Redemption and Atonement by Joel Biermann
description: This is the third talk in Joel Biermann's lecture series presented at the AALC National Convention. In this talk, Dr. Biermann speaks about the atonement, redemption, and free will.

title: Humanity as Fallen by Joel Biermann
description: This is the second in a series of lectures from Dr. Joel Biermann delivered at the 2018 AALC National Convention. In this talk, Biermann discusses the effects of the Fall on humanity.

title: Heraclitus (A History of Western Thought 3)
description: This is the third part in our series on the history of Western thought, in which we discuss Heraclitus.

title: Humanity in Creation by Joel Biermann
description:
This is a lecture from Dr. Joel Biermann at the 2018 National Convention of the AALC. This talk discusses the role of man and woman in creation. 

To help support the work of Just and Sinner, you can help through Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: The Pythagoreans (A History of Western Thought 2)
description: This is video number two in the series, "A History of Western Thought." In this video, we explore the ideas of Pythagoras and his influence on Western thought.

title: Were the Church Fathers all Synergists?
description: This is an answer to a question I received about the theology of the church fathers in which a listener claimed that all of them were synergists.

title: The First Philosophers (A History of Western Thought 1)
description: This is the beginning of a new series of videos on the history of Western thought. This first video discusses the beginnings of philosophy in 6th century ancient Greece.

title: Is a belief in the Real Presence Cannibalism?
description: It is sometimes claimed that Lutherans, Roman Catholics, and others who confess Christ's real presence in the Supper are guilty of cannibalism. This video addresses that concern.

title: Were the Church Fathers all Premillennial?
description: This is an answer to a question I was asked regarding the millennial views of the church fathers.

title: What is the Lutheran view of the End Times?
description: In this video, I answer the question: What is the Lutheran view of the end times? I discuss the various millennial views and dispensationalism.

title: Do Lutherans Believe in Covenant Theology?
description: In this video, I address the question: Do Lutherans believe in covenant theology? This idea is popular in the Reformed tradition, but the Lutheran has not privileged the notion of covenant to the same degree.

title: Why Do You Use Icons and other Images in Worship?
description: In this video, I discuss the use of images in the Lutheran church, and their function. I differentiate between the Lutheran and Eastern Orthodox use of iconography.

title: The Roots of Modern Gender Theory
description: In this video, I discuss the ideological roots of modern gender theory. In particular, I talk about the writings of Simone de Beauvoir.

title: Apostasy in John 15
description: In this video, I discuss the "I am the Vine," discourse of Jesus in John 15. I demonstrate that Jesus speaks clearly about the real possibility of apostasy from the faith in this text. Some are united to the vine and then cut off.

title: Intro to Apologetics
description: An introduction to Christian Apologetics for my seminary class at ALTS.

title: Are Works of the Law Only Ceremonial Works?
description: Paul speaks about justification apart from works of the law in Romans and Galatians. Some interpret this to simply exclude ceremonial acts from justification. I show why this interpretation is wrong.

title: Question and Answer Podcast April 7, 2018
description: This is a Q&A podcast, answering your questions on a number of different subjects.

title: Five Proofs that Christ's True Body and Blood are Present in the Sacrament
description:
These are five proofs of the real presence of the body and blood of Christ in the sacrament of the Lord's Supper. 

This is the book I referenced:
https://www.amazon.com/Lutheran-Doctrine-Supper-American-Classics-ebook/dp/B00HBAWDGQ/

Here is a link to further podcasts on the topic:
http://www.patheos.com/blogs/justandsinner/the-lords-supper-in-the-early-church/

title: Should we pray to the saints?
description: In this video, the question "should we pray to the saints?" is answered.

title: Are Lutherans Inconsistent Monergists?
description: Are Lutherans monergists? Or are they synergists? I get this question a lot. In this clip, I answered the objection that Lutherans are not truly monergists due to the contention that true believers can and do fall from the faith.

title: Are Some Cultures Better than Others?
description: On this video, I address the question of whether some cultures are better than others.

title: Jordan Peterson's Interpretation of Scripture
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner
One of the areas in which Jordan Peterson has become well known is through his talks on the Bible. This video includes my thoughts on Jordan Peterson's views on Scripture. I discuss both modernism and postmodernism in his reading of the text.

title: Law and Gospel by Curt Leins
description: Dr. Curt Leins spoke on the topic of law and gospel at the Hold the Line Conference.

title: Lutheran and Reformed Differences on Justification
description:
In this video, the question is answered: Are there differences between the Lutheran and Reformed views on justification? The uniquenesses of each tradition is explained and contrasted.

This originally comes from the following podcast: https://youtu.be/gggjykDMiuA

title: Dr. Curtis Leins on the Sacraments
description: This is a talk delivered by the Rev. Dr. Curtis Leins on the topic of the sacraments at the Hold the Line Conference, which was held in West Virginia, and sponsored by the American Association of Lutheran Churches (AALC). The recording was done on a cell phone from a distance, so the video quality is not great. I cleaned up the audio some, but it still is not perfect. Don't let that stop you from watching or listening, however. Dr. Leins has excellent insights on this important topic!

title: Is Revelation 12 About Mary?
description: This clip addresses the subject of Revelation chapter 12, which some people take to be a reference to the Virgin Mary. Other interpretations believe that this is about Israel, or the church.

title: Sermon on Joel 1
description: This is a sermon from my midweek Lenten series on the first chapter of Joel.

title: Flooding in Our Church
description: We recently experienced terrible flooding here in central Illinois, which unfortunately affected our church building. If you would like to help us repair the damage, go to http://www.youcaring.com/faithlutheranchurch-1114147

title: Response to Jordan Peterson and Ben Shapiro on Religion (Rubin Report)
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

This video is a response to the Ben Shapiro and Jordan Peterson dialogue on religion on the Rubin report. At about the 48 minute mark, they began discussing religion. During this discussion, there were some significant issues with what was said, and an orthodox Christian voice was unfortunately lacking. In this video, I address Ben Shapiro's ideas about religion and Jordan Peterson's notion of God.

title: Five Problems with Contemporary Intellectual Discourse
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video, I address five problems with intellectual discourse in today's society.

title: On Sexual Abuse in the Church
description: The issue of sexual abuse has been brought up a lot recently, especially because of the #metoo movement, alongside of the problems in Hollywood. Unfortunately, the church has not always handled these issues properly either, which resulted in the popular hashtag #churchtoo. In this video, I give my thoughts on the subject, and talk about some practical things that congregations can do in such situations.

title: Was Martin Luther a Nominalist?
description: This video is a clip from a Q&A podcast in which I addressed the question, "Was Martin Luther a nominalist?" I talked about different philosophical schools of thought and their influence upon the reformer.

title: The Adam God Teaching: A Problem for Mormonism
description:
This video addresses the Adam God doctrine as taught by Brigham Young. Though the modern LDS church denies it, early prophets claimed to believe it by revelation of God. 

The manuscript of this video can be found here: http://admin.patheos.com/blogs/justandsinner/?p=3657&preview=true

title: Why I am not Reformed
description:
This is a clip from a podcast in which I answered a listener question about why I left the Reformed church. This gives a basic overview of some of the reasons, though they are much more extensive than can be explained here. 

The full podcast is here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gggjykDMiuA&t=2260s

Help us out on Patreon:
http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

title: Faith and Mental Health Issues
description: This video addresses the subject of the Christian faith and mental health issues in light of the recent Desiring God tweet that seemed to imply that faith automatically resolves such problems.

title: An Explanation of Infused Righteousness
description:
This clip is taken from a Q&A podcast where I answered a question about infused and imputed righteousness, and explained the difference between these two ideas.

Here is the original podcast video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gggjykDMiuA&t=2260s

title: The Difference Between Lutheran and Reformed Christology
description:
This is a clip from a question and answer podcast I recorded in which a brief explanation of differences between the Christology of the Lutheran and Reformed traditions is explained. 

The full podcast can be found here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0qLjThWI78&t=1381s

title: Theosis and Christification Explained
description: The notion of Theosis is often a confusing one, especially for Western Christians. In this video, I give an overview of what that teaching is, and explain the approach that I call Christification.

title: What Lutherans Believe about Salvation
description:
My website: http://www.jordanbcooper.com
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

What do Lutherans believe about salvation? That question is answered here. Like and subscribe for other videos like this.

Check out this other video which addresses a question regarding the necessity of Baptism for salvation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yIUgdn-iQbQ

title: Five Benefits of Liturgical Worship
description:
Liturgical worship has many benefits. There are strong reasons why some churches prefer to worship with traditional liturgy rather than contemporary forms. These are five benefits of that traditional worship form. 

Patreon:
http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

title: Can a True Christian Fall away From the Faith?
description:
Can a true Christian fall away from the faith? Is the idea of "once saved always saved" a Biblical one? What do the passages about falling away mean? All of these questions are answered in this video.

The podcasts I mentioned:
http://www.patheos.com/blogs/justandsinner/perseverance-and-apostasy/

Also, check out my book cited here:
https://www.amazon.com/Great-Divide-Lutheran-Evaluation-Reformed-ebook/dp/B015DC4SAC/

Help out on Patreon:
http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

title: Confronting Racism in the Church
description: Racial issues have been a problem in the church for centuries, and they have recently popped up again in a movement known as Kinism. This video discusses the sin of racism, speaking about racism in the church.

title: Problems with the Mormon Doctrine of God
description: One of the unique aspects of Mormonism is their approach to the divine nature. The belief of Mormons that God was once a man who achieved exaltation sets up a strong opposition between this religion and classical Christian theology, as well as other traditional monotheistic faiths. In this video, the Mormon doctrine of God is examined in light of the traditional Christian view of God.

title: Why Should I Go To Church?
description: Why should I go to church? If I am a Christian, do I have to attend church? Isn't it enough if I just worship God at home? These questions are answered in this video, as Rev. Cooper explains the importance of attending the Divine Service as God has instituted it for his people.

title: The Book of Abraham: A Fraudulent Text
description:
The Book of Abraham has been a continuous problem for the veracity of Joseph Smith's claims which led to the formation of the Mormon church. This video addresses these problem and responds to common Mormon apologetic arguments. 

The content of this video is originally from my blog, here:
http://www.patheos.com/blogs/justandsinner/problems-with-mormonism-the-book-of-abraham/

Support this channel on Patreon:
http://www.patreon.com/justandsinner

title: The Infralapsarian Supralapsarian Debate
description: This entry in the theology video encyclopedia answers addresses the debate between the infralapsarian and supralapsarian positions within Calvinism.

title: Why Lutheran?
description:
In this video I address the question: why Lutheran?

What do Lutherans believe? Read our Confessions at 
http://www.BookofConcord.org.

Support Just and Sinner through Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: The New Perspective on Paul
description: This video is part of a project titled "Theology Video Encyclopedia," which is intended to be a resource giving brief definitions and explanations of important theological concepts. If you would like to contribute, please visit https://www.patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: Scholasticism
description: This video is part of a project titled "Theology Video Encyclopedia," which is intended to be a resource giving brief definitions and explanations of important theological concepts. If you would like to contribute, please visit https://www.patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: Are Christians Required to Tithe?
description:
Many churches require that congregants offer up ten percent of their income to the church. The New Testament, however, never actually states this.

Is tithing Biblical?

Is tithing for today? Or was it only for Old Testament Israel?

title: Thoughts on Christians and Conspiracy Theories
description: Many Christians are interested in conspiracy theories. Sometimes, this interest can become a kind of obsession, which can be damaging to faith. These are my comments on the topic of conspiracy theories.

title: Are we not supposed to judge?
description:
Jesus used the famous words, "judge not, lest you be judged." People often use this phrase to argue that no one is ever supposed to judge anyone else. However, this is based on a misunderstanding of Jesus' words, as is clear in other parts of the New Testament.

Patreon.com/justandsinner

title: Do we Have Free Will?
description: Christians often debate the subject of free will. Here, this issue is discussed, and it is explained that in one sense, we do have free will, and in another, we do not.

title: Is it Wrong to Call Your Pastor Father?
description: Jesus says to the Pharisees, "call no man father," and yet some Christians refer to their pastor or priest by that name. This video tackles the question: how are we to understand what Jesus says? Is he condemning the use of the term father in every single context? Or perhaps, is there more to what is going on here?

title: What is the Millennium in Scripture?
description:
The Millennium is a much-debated doctrine among Christians. Here, the Biblical text is examined.

Help me out on Patreon:
Patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: Five Problems with the Rapture
description:
Many Christians believe that Jesus will return secretly before a seven year tribulation. However, the Biblical evidence shows something different.

Go to my Patreon page: 
https://www.patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: What is Pietism?
description: The term Pietism is thrown around a lot in theological circles. This video explains the meaning of that term.

title: Is Baptism Necessary for Salvation?
description: Is Baptism necessary for salvation? Can anyone be saved without Baptism? This is a brief answer to those questions.

title: Is Baptismal Regeneration Salvation by Works?
description: This is an answer to the common question as to whether a belief in Baptismal Regeneration contradicts justification by faith alone.

title: What is Hyper Calvinism?
description: In this video, I address the question "What is Hyper Calvinism?" Often this term is used incorrectly, but there is an actual historical definition!

title: Q&A Live Podcast Recording 11/30/2017
description: This was a live podcast, answering all of your listener questions!

title: A Refutation of Dawkins' Ultimate Boeing 747 Argument
description: In this video I continue our series responding to skeptics with a refutation of the ultimate boeing 747 argument proposed by Richard Dawkins in The God Delusion.

title: The Church (Augsburg Confession Articles VII-VIII)
description: This lecture was given by Rev. Richard Shields at the 2017 Reformation Conference of the AALC. The topic is the church as taught in the Augsburg Confession articles VII and VIII.

title: Glorification and Christ's Return (Augsburg Confession Article XVII)
description: In this lecture, Rev. Chris Rosebrough speaks about glorification and the return of Christ. This message was given at the 2017 Reformation Conference of the AALC.

title: Good Works in the Christian Life (Augsburg Confession Article VI)
description: This lecture is one given by Rev. Jordan Cooper on the topic of Good Works and the Christian Life at the 2017 AALC celebration of the Reformation.

title: Holy Baptism (Augsburg Confession Article IX)
description: This talk was given by the Rev. Dr. Curtis Leins on the doctrine of Holy Baptism at the AALC's commemoration of the Lutheran Reformation.

title: The Office of the Ministry (Augsburg Confession Article V)
description: This talk was given by Rev. Joe Dapelo at the AALC Reformation Conference in commemoration of the 500th anniversary of the Lutheran Reformation. His topic is the office the ministry.

title: The Doctrine of Justification (Augsburg Confession Article IV)
description:
This lecture was given by Rev. Nathan Hoff at the AALC's 2017 Reformation Conference commemorating the 500th Anniversary of the Lutheran Reformation. This is the first lecture on the doctrine of justification. 

I apologize for the bad video quality, which was the result of the lighting at the venue.

title: The Flaw in the "God of the Gaps" Argument
description: This is the second in a series of videos I am releasing which addresses arguments from skeptics of the Christian faith. In this video, I demonstrate the flaws inherent in the supposed "God of the gaps" argument.

title: Why Do Christians Eat Shellfish? A Response to Skeptics
description:
In this new series, I address common questions about the Christian faith raised by skeptics. In this video, I discuss why Christians do not follow the food laws of the Old Testament. 

My Patreon page can be found here: patreon.com/JustandSinner

title: My New Book: Lex Aeterna
description:
I recently released a new book titled: Lex Aeterna: A Defense of the Orthodox Lutheran Doctrine of God's Law and Critique of Gerhard Forde. 

The book can be found here:
https://www.amazon.com/Lex-Aeterna-Orthodox-Lutheran-Doctrine/dp/153261635X/

title: Five Problems with Limited Atonement
description: This video addresses five problems with the Reformed idea of limited atonement, also known as particular redemption.

title: Five Lutheran Books that Every Christian Should Read
description: I am often asked about books that one should read in order to gain a better understanding of the Christian faith from a Lutheran perspective. In this video, I discuss five books that I frequently recommend. Along with these, I also recommend reading the Lutheran Confessions, which is the official doctrinal statement of the Lutheran church. These can be found on BookofConcord.org.

title: Five Reasons Why the Bible Does Not Teach a Flat Earth
description: The once universally mocked idea of a "flat earth" has recently seen a revival, especially on Youtube. One of the tactics of flat earth proponents is to argue that this is the teaching of Scripture. In this video, five reasons are given as to why this argument fails, as I address the question: what does the Bible teach about the flat earth?

title: Five Scriptural Proofs that Baptism Saves
description: Many people today think that baptism is symbolic act that one undergoes in order to demonstrate one's faith. Scripture teaches, however, that baptism is a saving work of God. These are five verses that teach this truth.

title: Five Problems with the Book of Mormon
description: These are five problems with the Book of Mormon, and to doubt its authenticity as an ancient document.

title: Five Reasons Why Babies Should be Baptized
description: These are five reasons to support the Biblical practice of infant Baptism.

title: The Responsibilities of the Christian Prince According to Augustine, Luther, and America
description: Rev.Dr. Eric Phillips spoke on Christian rulers in St. Augustine and Martin Luther.

title: Two Cities, Two Kingdoms: Augustine and Luther on Church and State
description: Rev. Dr. Eric Phillips spoke on Augustine and Luther on the two cities and two kingdoms at the 2016 Just and Sinner conference.

title: Worship as the Agent of Cultural Transformation
description: This is a lecture on worship and cultural transformation from the 2016 Just and Sinner conference on the two kingdoms and Lutheran thought.

title: How God Governs Economics Gene Veith
description: This lecture was given by Dr. Gene Edward Veith on God and economics at the 2016 Just and Sinner Conference on the Two Kingdoms.

title: The Two Kingdom Paradigm & Escondido Theology
description: This is a lecture on two kingdom theology which discusses the Lutheran approach in relation to theologians at Westminster Seminary in Escondido, CA.

title: Two Kingdoms Roundtable
description: This is a roundtable discussion on the doctrine of the two kingdoms at the 2016 Just and Sinner Conference.

title: Gene Veith on the Two Kingdoms
description: This is a lecture given by Dr. Gene Edward Veith on the Two Kingdoms titled, "The Two Kingdoms as a Paradigm for Criticism," from the 2016 Just and Sinner Conference in Watseka, IL.

title: The Redemption of Creation in a Two Kingdom Context
description: This is a breakout session from the 2016 Just and Sinner Conference.  In this discussion, Rev. Jordan Cooper discusses the nature of creation, the effects of the fall upon creation, and how the Christian interacts with God's creation in light of the two kingdoms.

title: A Defense of the Morality of the Old Testament
description: This is a response to moral criticisms of the Bible given by AronRa. I deal with the issues of slavery, rape, Biblical prophecy, and the foundations of morality.

title: In Defense Baptismal Regeneration (Part 3)
description: On today's program, I responded again to Rev. Brian Schwertley on the subject of baptismal regeneration. I addressed several misunderstandings of the doctrine and other important questions.

title: Defense of Baptismal Regeneration Part 2
description: On today's program, I continued to discuss baptismal regeneration in response to Rev. Brian Schwertley's lecture "Sacramentalism Refuted."  I deal with common arguments against baptismal regeneration, such as the contention that the thief on the cross was not baptized, and that if faith saves, baptism cannot.

title: My New Book: Hands of Faith
description: An introduction to my book Hands of Faith: A Historical and Theological Study of the Two Kinds of Righteousness in Lutheran Thought.  You can purchase this book from Amazon, Wipf and Stock, Barnes and Noble, and other online book retailers.

title: Abortion in Scripture: A Response to AronRa
description: On today's program, I responded to part of a lecture given by Youtuber AronRa titled, "Why does anyone believe the Bible?" The discussion is primarily focused on the Christian belief that abortion is murder in light of AronRa's contention that the Bible supports a pro-choice stance.

title: A Defense of Baptismal Regeneration in Response to Brian Schwertley
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

This is a recording of the Just and Sinner Podcast from August 30, 2016. In it, I respond to a sermon given by Brian Schwertley wherein he argues against baptismal regeneration.

title: Introduction to Thomas Aquinas and Thirteen Century Scholasticism
description: Today's program (8/23/2016) was an introduction to St. Thomas Aquinas and the thirteenth century in our ongoing overview of scholasticism. I delved into Albertus Magnus, Thomas' writings, the doctrine of God, and the use of Aristotle in Medieval theology.

title: Live Q&A Podcast 8/19/2016
description: This is a podcast I recorded live on facebook. I answered listener questions about a number of different issues, such as the office of the ministry, baptism, and more.

title: Why Do You Use Liturgy in Worship?
description: In this video, Rev. Cooper gives a brief explanation of why the church should utilize a liturgical form of worship on Sunday mornings.

title: What is the Book of Concord, and Why Should we Read it?
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video, Rev. Cooper discusses the Book of Concord, the confessional documents of the Lutheran church.

title: The Three Uses of the Law
description: Rev. Jordan Cooper explains the three uses, or functions, of God's law in the life of the Christian.

title: The Distinction Between Law and Gospel
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video, Rev. Jordan Cooper explains the importance of distinguishing God's commands from his promises.

My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com

title: The Great Divide: A Lutheran Evaluation of Reformed Theology
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

This is a brief introduction to my new book titled "A Great Divide: A Lutheran Evaluation of Reformed Theology." You can purchase the book from Amazon, Barnes and Noble, and other major booksellers.

title: The Doctrine of Election
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

The doctrine of election has caused many debates within the history of the church. It has often caused despair and doubt. Yet, the New Testament speaks of election as a message of comfort to the Christian. In this video, Rev. Cooper explains the Biblical teaching of predestination.

title: Two Kinds of Righteousness
description: The doctrine of the "two kinds of righteousness" is an important aspect of Christian theology. With this distinction, the proper roles of both faith and works are explained within the Christian life. In this video, Rev. Jordan Cooper explains this teaching.

title: What is the Ordo Salutis?
description:
My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com
Patreon: http://www.Patreon.com/justandsinner

In this video, Rev. Jordan Cooper introduces the concept of the ordo salutis.

title: The Diminution of the Pastoral Office
description: Rev. Dr. Curtis Leins (the presiding pastor of the AALC) presented this lecture on the Diminution of the Pastoral Office at the 2015 AALC pastor's retreat.

title: The Pastor as Teacher of the Liturgy by Rev. Dr. Curtis Leins
description: Rev. Dr. Curtis Leins (presiding pastor of the AALC) presented this paper at the 2015 AALC pastor's retreat on the topic of the liturgy.

title: Ordo Salutis Roundtable
description: Following the six lectures, all of the presenters at the Just and Sinner conference had a roundtable discussion surrounding the topics discussed throughout the conference.

title: Sanctification
description: Rev. Dr. Curtis Leins presented this lecture on sanctification at the 2015 Just and Sinner Conference in Watseka, IL.

title: The Doctrine of Justification
description: Lewis Polzin joined Jordan Cooper at the 2015 Just and Sinner Conference for a live podcast recording. They continued their discussion of Henry Eyster Jacobs' book A Summary of the Christian Faith, and talked about the doctrine of justification.

title: Justification by Faith Alone
description: Rev. Dr.  Curtis Leins presented this presentation on the doctrine of justification at the 2015 Just and Sinner Conference.

title: The Ordo Salutis: Why it is neglected today, and why it matters

My website: http://www.JordanBCooper.com

This is the first talk from the 2015 Just and Sinner Conference on the history and teaching of the ordo salutis within the Lutheran tradition. This presentation was given by Jordan Cooper.

http://justandsinner.blogspot.com/2013/08/the-lutheran-rosary.html

title: Universal Atonement in 2 Peter 2:1

title: Universal Atonement in 1 Timothy 2:4
